sub_title: Associate Professor | Foundation Director | Advisor in Area Development
summary:
University Professor, Foundation Director and Advisor in Strategic Urban Planning & Real Estate Development.

Specialties: Governance of Area Development Projects, particularly Waterfront Development Projects in contemporary Port Cities.

De SKG, dat al meer dan 40 publieke en private leden kent, richt zich op actuele uitdagingen in het vakgebied, leidt professionals op en draagt bij aan de ontwikkeling en verspreiding van (wetenschappelijke) kennis van en voor gebiedsontwikkeling in Nederland. De kracht van de SKG zit in haar werkwijze. Met de Leerstoel Gebiedsontwikkeling aan de TU Delft komt een productieve verbinding tussen wetenschap en praktijk tot stand: het uitwisselen van inzichten, het creëren van praktische handreikingen en het aanjagen van innovatieve oplossingen voor de duurzame (her)ontwikkeling van gebieden.', 'title': 'Directeur', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 166529, 'name': 'Delft University of Technology', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFwaGpwaod9mQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1670699851986?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=772a-buTMRhp4JFw5Lp2WIlZQJ_rGzWG5O_wmvG3oQQ', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/tudelft/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2003}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Faculty of Architecture and the Built Environment', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Delft University of Technology', 'description': "Welcome to my LinkedIn-profile!

ABOUT ME
My passion is to help students and professionals become effective city makers. To do this, I provide principles, concepts and tools for inclusive, interdisciplinary collaboration (public-private-civic) in urban development research and practice. My goal is to strive for sustainable, area-based solutions to collective urban problems. 

At TU Delft, my research work focuses on understanding what it takes to create sustainable urban environments. Cases range from urban transformation projects to the development of innovative, highly specialised urban clusters in the world's most exciting delta regions. 

Within Delft's Faculty of Architecture and the Built Environment, I lead the Area Development team--a group of talented scholars and editors that is dedicated to help students and professionals understand city making and act effectively in shaping sustainable urban environments.   

ABOUT YOU
1. You are a student or scholar with governance and management questions regarding urban (re)development (i.e. regeneration or city building) projects, or you are more specifically interested in the evolution of industry-city relations and port-urban waterfront zones.
2. You are a professional eager to learn about the state-of-the-art in city making, with a special interest in complex assignments like waterfront development in seaport cities and/or urbanising delta regions. 

HOW I CAN HELP
Students and professionals:
• Links to inspiring educational programs or knowledge networks
• Feedback on given urban (re)development and transformation assignments
• Solutions for complex waterfront development problems in seaport regions

Scholars:
• Collaborate in research proposals and projects
• Co-develop research publications and education material
• Co-create a network for sustainable waterfronts and port-city relations

INTERESTED?
